meanings.definition: The process of constructing or using canals for transportation or irrigation.
meanings.sent1: The canalisation of water from the river helped the farmers irrigate their fields.
meanings.sent2: The canalisation of goods through the waterways reduced transportation costs.
meanings.sent3: The canalisation project turned the dry land into a green oasis.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas flowed through the team like a well-planned canalisation.
meanings.sent5: The canalisation of resources ensured a steady supply for the community.

meanings.definition: The act of directing something into a particular course or channel.
meanings.sent1: The canalisation of thoughts towards a common goal led to success.
meanings.sent2: The canalisation of traffic into designated lanes improved road safety.
meanings.sent3: His canalisation of jokes always made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for music canalised her energy into creative compositions.
meanings.sent5: The canalisation of efforts into one project brought remarkable results.

meanings.definition: The act of making something more streamlined or efficient.
meanings.sent1: The canalisation of the production process increased efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The canalisation of communication within the team reduced errors.
meanings.sent3: His canalisation of study habits improved his grades significantly.
meanings.sent4: The canalisation of tasks made the project completion faster.
meanings.sent5: The canalisation of resources saved time and money for the company.
